ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned grammar and vocabulary. We practiced speaking and how to organize our ideas to make an argument.
I greatly improved my Korean speaking and writing proficiency, and gained a much better understanding of contemporary issues in Korean and American society and the vocabulary needed to discuss them.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Even online, this was an amazing course.  effectively used break out rooms to give us time to speak in small groups which also made it feel more personal which was especially important since it was on Zoom. The teaching style works well and a variety of methods are used so we can all learn the material and remember how to use it.

is by far this courses best strength. Shes wonderful! I wish we reviewed grammar more at the beginning, but when  heard our feedback regarding this, she immediately added grammar reviews. Shes the best!

One strength of this course was its utilization of near-constant discussion throughout class to help build students' comfort and fluency in spoken Korean.  This course also benefited from its use of a wide array of media - from podcasts to short video clips to full movies - to introduce a broad spectrum of historical and social topics related to modern Korea.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The use of break out rooms was very helpful. It ensured we could all speak during class time and also got to know our classmates a little better.
The zoom meetings worked well for this class.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, this is absolutely a wonderful course that anyone should take.  really cares about all of her students and wants us to learn, do well, and be happy.
Absolutely - this course provided a fantastic opportunity to continue learning about Korean language, culture, and society in a relaxed atmosphere.
